repnme.cdata!: Chad - Public Works and Capacity Building Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The project outcome was unsatisfactory,
            sustainability unlikely, and the institutional development
            impact negligible. Initial supervision missions were
            understaffed, and inattentive to difficulties, which despite
            improvements in the later phases of supervision, resulted in
            an unsatisfactory Bank performance. Similarly, failure to
            establish appropriate management systems, and the weak
            results of physical components, assesses an unsatisfactory
            Borrower performance. Lessons show the delicate balance of
            implementing agencies in handling large amounts, and
            different types of work, under weak capacity situations, and
            lack of experience. The Agence Tchadienne d'Execution
            de Travaux d'Interet Public (ATETIP) committed itself
            to an extraordinary amount of projects, and the new Agence
            d'Execution de Travaux d'Interet Public (AGETIP),
            proved inexperienced, particularly with the introduction of
            private contracting practices into prevailing government
            administration experience. This clearly demands intensive
            technical assistance, to build capacity, which should
            include a careful assessment of staff with private sector
            experience. Also, the specialized nature of delegated
            contract management, require adequate supervision to conduct
            financial, and technical reviews, able to identify, and
            remedy problematic subprojects, prior to implementation.

repnme.cdata!: Chad - Public Works and Capacity Building Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The objectives of the Public Works and
            Capacity Building Project for Chad are: (a) to build local
            capacity; (b) to assist the government in maintaining
            infrastructure assets; (c) to participate in reducing
            current unemployment by creating temporary jobs in the
            public works and construction sector; and (d) to improve
            public procurement and contract management practices. The
            project components are: (a) an investment component aimed at
            protecting the existing infrastructure from further decay
            and developing additional urgently needed social
            infrastructure; (b) a capacity building component providing
            training and technical support for small-and medium-sized
            enterprises and the beneficiaries (local governments and
            ministries); (c) a component aimed at increasing community
            maintenance; (d) a component of services aimed at project
            monitoring; and (e) a procurement reform implementation
            component aimed at improving the transparency and efficiency
            of the procurement process by identifying the current
            bottlenecks and providing consulting services for the
            revision of the procurement code.

abstracts.cdata!:
The objectives of the Public Works and
            Capacity Building Project are: (a) to build local capacity;
            (b) to assist the government in maintaining infrastructure
            assets; (c) to participate in reducing current unemployment
            by creating temporary jobs in the public works and
            construction sector; and (d) to improve public procurement
            and contract management practices. The project components
            are: (a) an investment component aimed at protecting the
